author: rafa3ls
content: I am having an issue, the client does not connect with any peer after several minutes ("RPC timeout" msg on shisui), sometimes it connects hence it is an intermittent issue,  but lately, I am not been able to connect. Tested already with several flags upnp, stun, extip and I am having the same issue with trin and shisui, I strongly believe that this is a transversal NAT problem, this is my network:

author: rafa3ls
content: I can connect straight to router 2 but I only have access to the router1 setup, and I guess router2 does not have upnp. I tried already to route my phone's 4g connection with all flags upnp (no idea if my android has upnp), stun, extip, still does not work.

author: rafa3ls
content: I am not an expert, but as of my knowledge transversal nat has no solution, TURN sounds like men in the middle, not sure if it is safe...

author: rafa3ls
content: Does anyone know of a solution?

author: grapebaba
content: <@835295560172568636> glad to see you back, the nat update will print a log in trace level, do you see any glue there.

author: rafa3ls
content: Thanks, glad to see you too, I am using nat stun and yes I see a glue. Shisui is sending/receiving `TALKREQ/TALKRESP/FINDNODE/NODE` in diskv5 and `PING/PONG/FINDNODE/NODE` in history, buckets seems to be filled. The weird is that there is no `FINDCONTENT`, and it should since I have no data. I will investigate why it is not doing lookup.

author: rafa3ls
content: `RPC` endpoints are working and I can retrieve content in history, it is when I see `FINDCONTENT`, I am not sure if it should lookup for content automatically. I tested run two nodes locally (diferent ports), get some content with the first one and `OFFER` to the second and, got error `"RPC timeout"`, the secnd node did not receive any `OFFER`. Everything seems fine with portal and Shisui, still believe it is a nat transversal issue.
